metadata.title: CVE-2020-24587 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: The 802.11 standard that underpins Wi-Fi Protected Access (WPA, WPA2, andWPA3) and Wired Equivalent Privacy (WEP) doesn't require that all fragmentsof a frame are encrypted under the same key. An adversary can abuse this todecrypt selected fragments when another device sends fragmented frames andthe WEP, CCMP, or GCMP encryption key is periodically renewed.
